chargeHist.descr: Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin Edward Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Physical Abuse of An Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.198(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Physical Abuse of An  Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin Edward Anderson

records.addlTxt: Defendant failed to report to the House of Correction.  Court withdrew Huber privileges. Original commitment issued for service and filed.

Failure to Report Commitment Referral
.
Failure to Report Commitment Referral received from the HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge SHELTON, Br 40, for review.

Defendant Kevin Edward Anderson in court with Attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Kevin Edward Anderson in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 141 days time served. The Court granted Huber privileges for work.  The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- 30 DAYS condition time at the House of Correction with Huber release for work, STAYED until 9-12-2022.  Court permanently stays condition time if the defendant is working a minimum of 40 hours per week by 9-12-2022. 
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment. 
- Provide DNA sample. 
- Full-time work. 
- Complete a mental health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment. 
- No contact with J.L.A.
- Pay domestic abuse and DNA surcharges. 

Court set restitution at zero.  Court ordered the defendant to pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DV and DNA) by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. 

20 day appeal rights given.
Received and Filed:  State's Offer Letter
Received and Filed: Elements of the Offense
Received and Filed: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum
Court set plea and sentencing date upon request by the defense.  Parties notified of date.  Plea and sentencing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 8:30 AM.

Defendant Kevin Edward Anderson in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Kevin Edward Anderson in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
   Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Court addresses substitution previously filed in Preliminary Hearing Court against Judge Wagner.  Based on the nature of the charges, matter reassigned to this court in error.  Case should be assigned to a general felony court.  Case reassigned to Judge Shelton, Br. 40 forthwith.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Wagner.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Borowski, Br. 12.

Defendant Kevin Edward Anderson in court with Attorney Richard L. Voss; both appear by video.  Defendant Kevin Edward Anderson in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 12, Judge David Borowski. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial.  Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Br. 12.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
filed.
Received and filed.
Richard Voss; filed.
Defendant's Motion Requesting Bail Modification Hearing.  (Kevin E. Anderson - #2022003753, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Kevin Edward Anderson not in court, defendant in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kevin Edward Anderson not in court, defendant in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a Preliminary hearing. SPD need more time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Joy A., and 7200 W. Burleigh St. property.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant Kevin Edward Anderson in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Kevin Edward Anderson in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
